the wait staff at hugos particularly victor and vincent deserve an extra star for their outstanding service they blew us away with their attentive and efficient assistance on the other hand the food itself left me underwhelmed despite the fact that the fillet was quite sizable it did not live up to its reputation as one of the best fillets i have ever tasted it lacked a certain uniqueness and failed to provide any unexpected delights however the mashed potatoes were undeniably the highlight of the meal even if they were potentially hazardous i would still indulge in them wholeheartedly in contrast my wife tried the veal which was edible but not memorable enough to order again the salads were enjoyable the service was exceptional and the wine list impressed us with its variety i would recommend visiting this restaurant if you find yourself downtown although i question whether it is worth the 20dollar cab fare to and from the strip
excellent service i have been coming here for years and i have never felt ripped off or gouged

i am giving hugos an additional star because the wait staff victor and vincent provided exceptional service that blew us away however the food was only average i ordered the fillet which was large but not one of the best ive ever had it lacked a distinctive taste failing to impress me nevertheless the mashed potatoes were absolutely phenomenal even if they had some potential health hazards i would still devour them in excessive amounts on the other hand my wife tried the veal finding it decent but not worth ordering again the salads were enjoyable the service was excellent and the wine list was extensive if you happen to be downtown its worth checking out this restaurant however im unsure if its worth taking a 20 cab ride each way from the strip just for the meal

having to endure a demanding 12hour work shift under the blazing sun with no respite or lunch break i couldnt help but feel exhilarated at the thought of dining at this restaurant everything seemed promising as we entered a clean and wellmaintained establishment regrettably our enthusiasm quickly waned when our food took an astonishing 4560 minutes to arrive despite ordering for two adults and a oneyearold infant predictably my baby grew increasingly tired and bored during the agonizing wait it was even more disheartening when the manager mistakenly thinking we were finished with our meal inquired if there was anything else he could do for us piqued by his assumption i clarified that we were still waiting for our main course which had yet to grace our table if only the eatery had offered some form of entertainment like movies or provided access to netflix on their television perhaps we would consider giving it another chance however with so many thai food options available elsewhere this particular place garners a disappointing two thumbs down from us making the taco shop located next door much more appealing

when it comes to food choices hotdogs especially chili dogs are a favorite for me and my family the excitement grew as we learned about this place and saw some rave reviews we were eager to give it a try even though it meant driving approximately 35 minutes from maricopa az where we currently reside hopes were high that the experience would justify the distance but unfortunately our expectations were let down our order comprised of 8 regular dogs with my personal preference being chili mustard and onions while the rest of my family stuck with ketchup alongside that we also decided to try their onion rings and a strawberry shake the sight of the hotdogs cooking on the grill was mouthwatering especially since i have a soft spot for grilled dogs with a crisp outer texture however when it came to taste all four of us were in unanimous agreement  they were disappointingly flavorless beyond bland they didnt even have basic seasoning like salt in particular the chili sauce turned out to be the worst ive ever encountered resembling more of a tomato paste suitable for spaghetti sauce than a flavorful chili as for the onion rings they were far from satisfactory  overcooked to the point where they resembled fragments or debris rather than complete rings their lack of actual onion inside only added to their underwhelming nature  most likely due to being burned or mishandled during preparation while the flavor of the strawberry shake was decent it arrived in a rather small 6 oz cup giving the impression that it was overpriced compared to everything else surprisingly i couldnt even finish my hotdogs which is an unprecedented occurrence for me its extremely rare for our entire family to come to a unanimous decision regarding a place but this time unfortunately we were in agreement  it wasnt good despite its visually appealing retrothemed interior and its seemingly thriving business we wont be revisiting adding to the dissatisfaction the employees appeared more like somber funeral home staff rather than enthusiastic members of a funthemed hot dog joint to add insult to injury the final bill amounted to almost 37 which we found utterly absurd considering the overall quality and portion sizes we received

when visiting las vegas there is a mustsee attraction that offers a breathtaking view while there are similar attractions available in california this particular ride showcases the strip in front red rock canyon in the back and the city of vegas to the left with the new neighborhood on the right the experience starts with the option of being picked up from your hotel or meeting at a starbucks to grab coffee before the sunrise the crew will explain the procedure and involve you in setting up and taking down the balloon once youre in the air the stunning aerial perspective of vegas quiets down the loud party city atmosphere as you face the red rock canyon the natural beauty becomes a calming and peaceful sight the friendly pilot and crew create an enjoyable experience cracking jokes and even sharing a story at the end of the ride with champagne and cheese i highly recommend trying vegas balloon rides
